definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The steps of the old house groaned under my weight.
sentences.chinese: 我的体重使老房子的楼梯吱嘎作响。

sentences.english: I heard a loud crunch as the truck ran into the wall.
sentences.chinese: 卡车撞到墙时，我听到一声大的嘎滋响。

sentences.english: With nearly every stride, our feet crunch spent rifle cartridges.
sentences.chinese: 几乎每走一步，脚下用过的步枪子弹都会吱嘎作响。

sentences.english: His spade cleaved the firm sand with a satisfying crunch.
sentences.chinese: 他的锹凿开了坚实的砂土，发出令人舒心的嘎扎声。

sentences.english: The truck ground to a stop.
Milonga is a dance simply for fun.
sentences.chinese: 米隆嘎跳舞只是为了好玩。

sentences.english: Subsequently, a sharp knives forced La Baolei special chew and swallow cackling sound about the meat.
sentences.chinese: 随后，鲍勒用尖刀强迫伯约特咀嚼并吞下嘎内的肉。

sentences.english: Why is there so much trouble?
sentences.chinese: 魜点解会有咁多嘎烦恼？

sentences.english: Han Jia, Zhaga Waterfall left a deep impression on me. Do you also have some impression?
sentences.chinese: 韩佳，这个扎嘎瀑布我的印象可深了。你也有印象吧？

sentences.english: The sixth was Gasi married to road divinity.
sentences.chinese: 第六个是嫁给路神的嘎姒。

sentences.english: She was chomping away on a bagel.
sentences.chinese: 她在嘎蹦嘎嘣地啃着一个硬面包圈。

sentences.english: She was chomping away on a bagel.
sentences.chinese: 她在嘎蹦嘎嘣地啃着一个硬面包圈。

sentences.english: Now I always have a tube by my bedside.
sentences.chinese: 恁嘎我床头单单有一支个个。

sentences.english: These type of questions can bring your interview to a screeching halt。
sentences.chinese: 类似的这些问题能让你的面试嘎然而止。

sentences.english: In a moment, we'll go to see Zhaga Waterfall.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿我们就要去看扎嘎瀑布。

sentences.english: I opened it with a creak, and the crying stopped.
sentences.chinese: 门吱嘎一声打开了，哭声也停了。

definition: (onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(onom.) quack/honk/(northern dialect) very/also pr. [ga1 ga5], [ga2 ga5] etc
denote a sound or sharp noise (gunfire etc)
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) for the sound of a bird, an empty stomach etc
